answerBox.snippet: Glass quality: Antique medicine bottles typically have lighter glass, narrow necks, and brittle walls. Manufacturing techniques: Prior to the 20th century, medicine bottles were usually handmade and had unique shapes and markings.
snippetHighlighted: lighter glass, narrow necks, and brittle walls

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to identify old medicine bottles?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Generally speaking the glass thickness of medicinal bottles is distinctly less than for soda/mineral water, beer, champagne, and most wine bottles. That is a diagnostic feature that can be useful in bottle fragment identification at times.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Medicinal Bottles - Society for Historical Archaeology

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if my old bottles are valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Check the bottle you have against the detailed description of the type. Note the value range for the bottle. Bottles in rare colors and great condition will fall at the higher end of the price range. Those with condition issues or in less desirable colors or shapes will fall at the lower end of the range.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 10 Old Bottles Worth Money & a Handy Price List - Yahoo

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I tell how old my bottle is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It is true that the mold seams can be used like a thermometer to determine the approximate age of a bottle. The closer to the top of the bottle the seams extend, the more recent was the production of the bottle.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Bottle Dating - Society for Historical Archaeology

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you date a bottle?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Most bottle manufacturers molded the year into the glass at the bottom of the bottle in 2-digit format. You'll often find it in the lower right portion when looking at the bottom (some dates are much easier to distinguish than others).
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How To Date / Identify Vintage Whiskey Bottles
